column4: How do you change the top and bottom images for the cube in beryl??
ben16s:If it is a server install it won't have X11
: ssh and putty x11 forwarding can't work on an ubuntu server??
Well a true server install won't have the xorg packages for a desktop
Servers don't use x11 because there is not a gui
But you can always add it with something like
aptitude install ubuntu-desktop
: yes but on my windows machine i've got Xming
It wasts resources to run a gui on a server though
: that's why i want to esxport it
Use nomachine instead of putty for X11 forwarding
It has always worked better for me anyway
: ok i will try
: because with ssh i've got the error message : can't open display
: when i launch an xclock app for example
ben16s:http://www.nomachine.com/
http://www.nomachine.com/download.php    for the download page
: it's for nx server??
no it is a client/server program for remote administration including x11, sound, and video forwarding
: so it can work with an ubuntu srver even if X server is not installed on it
Yes. It is not limited to X11 forwarding.
ben16s: Check out the documentation it should tell you how to do what you want with it
: ok i'll try, thanks
